divs: sighting detailsmy family was in lewiston (by gaylord) michigan on tee lake to celebrate the 4th of july holiday. we had just finished watching a 4th of july fireworks display from our property on the lake, and retreated to the campfire. some time after being by the fire, my father pointed out a bright orange fire ball object in the sky, much brighter than a star\sattlelite, and it was moving fairly fast across the sky to the right (from my view). i picked up the binoculars and tried to get a better look, but there was no detail of the object through the binoculars. it was an orange glow. it seemed to stop and hover over the moon for about 1 minute before disapearing. it was as if the object made a left at the moon and hightailed it away from earth. we all agreed that it was not a blinking light, but a constant light. it was too bright and round for a plane, it was to bright and fast for a satalite, and anyting in our orbit would not stop in mid flight and disapear.
Summary: Orange fire ball moving to the right (from my view) towards the moon faster than an air plane, Hovered over moon for a few minutes, disapeared.
trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Albert
There were no other sightings in Albert on or around July 4th 2009
